title: Cha-Ka
description: Will and Holly save a Pakuni ape-boy named Cha-Ka from Grumpy the Tyrannosaurus Rex.

title: The Sleestak God
description: While searching the Lost City, Will and Holly are captured by lizard-men which are known as Sleestak.

title: Dopey
description: A troublesome baby brontosaurus follows Will and Holly home.

title: Downstream
description: The Marshalls attempt to escape the Land of the Lost by river and wind up trapped in a cave with a daffy Confederate miner.

title: Tag-Team
description: While fleeing from the jaws of dinosaurs, the Marshalls and the Pakuni are forced to work together.

title: The Stranger
description: The Marshalls meet Enik, an intelligent, time-traveling relative of the Sleestak.

title: Album
description: Will and Holly are lured to the Lost City by a hypnotic stone which shows them a vision of their dead mother.

title: Skylons
description: When Will and Holly find a way into a pylon, they discover a device which summons a terrible storm.

title: The Hole
description: Rick joins forces with an intelligent Sleestak when they end up rooming together with the hungry Sleestak God in the Hole of No Return.

title: The Paku Who Came to Dinner
description: Cha-Ka is invited to dine with the Marshalls. Meanwhile, Holly's perfume drives the locals wild!

title: The Search
description: When Rick is shocked by magical crystals, Holly is forced to bring him home while Will goes to Enik for help.

title: The Possession
description: Cha-Ka and Holly become hypnotized by a baton-like object from a mysterious pylon.

title: Follow That Dinosaur
description: The Marshalls find half a diary from a former human resident of the Land of the Lost that might hold the key to returning to the real world.

title: Stone Soup
description: The Marshalls have to barter with the Pakuni to reverse a drought.

title: Elsewhen
description: A mysterious woman named Rani steps through a time door and gives Holly advice on dealing with her fears and helping her family.

title: Hurricane
description: While fooling with a pylon, Will opens a time door that brings an astronaut and a hurricane to the Land of the Lost.

title: Circle
description: The Marshalls learn that their arrival in the Land of the Lost created a paradox in the door of time that's preventing Enik from returning home.

title: Tar Pit
description: When Dopey gets stuck in a tar pit, the Marshalls and Cha-Ka band together to try to pull him out.

title: The Zarn
description: While investigating the Mist Marsh, the guys stumble onto a mysterious woman who has a bit too much in common with Rick.

title: Fair Trade
description: When Rick stumbles into a pig trap with three Sleestak, Will and Holly turn to Enik and Ta for help rescuing him.

title: One of Our Pylons Is Missing
description: When a mysterious energy hole appears in the ground and swallows Cha-Ka, Holly attempts a rescue.

title: The Test
description: Cha-Ka gets some help from Will and Holly stealing one of Big Alice's eggs to pass the Pakuni rite of manhood test.

title: Gravity Storm
description: The Zarn is to blame when gravity begins weighing down the inhabitants of the Land of the Lost.

title: The Longest Day
description: When the sun stands still, the Sleestak wrongfully blame Rick for tampering with the pylon.

title: The Pylon Express
description: Holly tries to save Rick and Will after they go into a pylon to investigate a time door.

title: Nice Day
description: A quiet day of fishing, trap building and cake making turns serious when Holly is pricked by a poisonous plant.

title: Baby Sitter
description: When Holly spends the night alone with Cha-Ka, the Zarn causes a rift between Cha-Ka and Ta.

title: The Musician
description: While searching the temple in the Lost City, Holly gets a ring stuck on her finger and Cha-Ka unwittingly awakens the Builder.

title: Split Personality
description: Following an earthquake, a specter that resembles Holly materializes and pleads for help.

title: Blackout
description: Enik seeks Rick's help when the Sleestak execute a nefarious plan to plunge the world into darkness and overpopulate it with their offspring.

title: After-Shock
description: Rick is transported back to the real world just as his brother Jack arrives searching for the family. The Marshalls' cave dwelling is destroyed in an earthquake, so they take up residence in the temple at the Lost City, much to the chagrin of the Sleestak.

title: Survival Kit
description: In order to save an ailing Holly, the Marshalls have to get their survival kit back from a Cro-Magnon who's threatened to wipe out the Sleestak race.

title: The Orb
description: After stepping into a pylon, Will becomes invisible, so he uses his new gift to rescue Enik from the Sleestak.

title: Repairman
description: When the Sleestak tamper with the sunlight, an eccentric British repairman arrives to fix the problem.

title: Medusa
description: Holly is lured into the Garden of Eternity, where Medusa intends to make her a permanent resident.

title: Cornered
description: To receive the antidote for the venom coursing through Will's veins from Enik, the Marshalls must first rid the Lost City of a fire-breathing dinosaur.

title: Flying Dutchman
description: A mysterious Captain tries to take Holly away on his flying ship.

title: Hot-Air Artist
description: A hot air balloonist crashes on the Land of the Lost and promises to bring the Marshalls back to civilization... though he only intends to return with their uncivilized friend Cha-Ka.

title: Abominable Snowman
description: A yeti comes to call when Holly stakes claim to its unicorn.

title: Timestop
description: Will and Holly find a crystal that holds the key to time travel, which they must use to save Cha-Ka from certain death.

title: Ancient Guardian
description: The yeti goes on a rampage when the Marshalls disturb an ancient Sleestak statue.

title: Scarab
description: Cha-Ka's evil side is unleashed after being bitten by a beautiful beetle.

title: Medicine Man
description: The Marshalls get caught in the middle when a feuding soldier and Indian wander into the Land of the Lost.
